website_summaries.verdict: This strainer clips directly into your pot so you can grip pot handles with two hands.
pros: Clips will fit nearly all round pots, pans, and bowls – even ones with lips
Small and compact, easy to store
BPA free, dishwasher safe,  and FDA approved
Will withstand straining of heavier foods like potatoes
Lets you grip pot with both hands
cons: Too small for larger pots and quantities of food

customer_reviews.title: Bad product - annoying seller.
customer_reviews.text: This product was poorly made and didn't fit tightly enough to actually strain anything - everything just poured out no matter how I tried to use it. I returned it immediately. However, what bothers me the most about this product is the constant barrage of emails from the seller, asking me for reviews. I initially wasn't going to leave a bad review, and just quietly return the faulty product. But they just kept messaging me over and over again even after I asked them to stop.So here it is: The strainer doesn't work and the seller is annoying and harasses the customer. Maybe now they'll stop sending me emails.
customer_reviews.author: Emmiejaye

customer_reviews.title: Straining Grease is a Breeze
customer_reviews.text: This worked so well for draining beef grease from my large 12" fry pan. There was no leaking what so ever like I was afraid of. It poured perfectly into a small cup. I also used it to drain hot water from boiling noodles for the same dinner! I had tried everything to drain fat, from spooning it out, turkey bastering it, and most recently trying to scoop it out and pat it dry. This is a lifesaver! I cannot wait to use it again!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley M

customer_reviews.title: THIS IS THE BEST KITCHEN GADGET EVER MADE
customer_reviews.text: I cannot say enough good about this strainer. It fits all my pots from small to huge, even frying pans! I have strainers, colondars, every kind of lid converter...........This strainer is the best ever. When the pot is too heavy for me to hold to drain off the water, with this I can still hold on with both hands, and then when it is mostly drained, I set the pot in the sink to continue to drain (fidigity pastas) Washes up like a dream, or toss in the dishwasher. I do not know how I lived without this strainer. Now I can get rid of probably 20 items out of my kitchens!
customer_reviews.author: SGA

customer_reviews.title: Works with most pans!
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised at how well it worked! I can use it with grease to drain meat. I can drain water, or really whatever I want that's been in a pan. Wide mouth pans that are shallow once and a while spit things from the top if your not careful. But thats the only type of pan I have had to "babysit" the strainer. Very good buy for a simpler way to strain multiple things.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love this
customer_reviews.text: This makes it so much easier to dump out water when making pasta of any type. Fits very well to most sized pans and dishwasher safe. My 9 yr old granddaughter can now dump the water out of the Mac and cheese easily. This is a must have for people who make Pastas of any kind that require dumping out hot water. It is made out of a type of rubber so I’m not sure if I would use it for hot grease, but it may be ok for that too since a lot of spatulas etc are made from similar material
customer_reviews.author: Bill McNeil

customer_reviews.title: Recommend 100%
customer_reviews.text: We use this as our default strainer now for all cooking, and we cook a lot. The only time we need to bust out the huge colanders is when we're cooking with our pot that has a large curved lip/flange all around the top that's about 1/2" wide. This only clips on to normal, thin pot rims. This fits very flexibly on large and small pots, and has held up great in the dishwasher, and takes up sop much less space in use, in cleaning, and in storage than the big colanders. Just great!
customer_reviews.author: Ann Hendricks

customer_reviews.title: Definitely Recommend!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best gadget ever. I was a bit skeptical but decided to give it a try. It was always a hassle digging out the big colander to drain things from my pots, but no more. This nifty little gadget easily clips onto the edge of the pan (any size) and quickly and easily drains the liquid.The clean up is so much quicker than with using a large colander. My kids were so impressed they have all asked for one!
customer_reviews.author: Marbid3

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: This will be an unusual review coming from me.If you look at my review history you will see that I usually write negative reviews.I think this is better then great.Maybe I should say brilliant.It firmly holds on all my pots and pans.It allows me to toss 4 different tools.A sieve,a strainer,a colander and a spaghetti spoon.It seems to be very solidly constructed and it has a 2 year guarantee.If it breaks after 2 years I will buy another.
customer_reviews.author: don g

customer_reviews.title: I loved this. I used it a few times
customer_reviews.text: I loved this. I used it a few times, always washed it on the top tray of the dishwasher. See photo below. It came out of the dishwasher that way. The clip is disintegrating. This is on the outside. It does not touch the pot. More to know: After I saw this, I saw that Amazon has informed me that I cannot send it back. It had an expiration date!!!
customer_reviews.author: Reddrabbitt

customer_reviews.title: JUNK!
customer_reviews.text: I first user this gadget when ATTEMPTING TO drain spaghetti. 90% of the pasta ended in the sink. Needless to say, this POS ended in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: MizzTea

customer_reviews.title: Great product, great buy! Works on 12 in skillet also
customer_reviews.text: I waited awhile to give my review. I wasn't sure how often I would use this but turns out " a lot". It strains hot foods very easily. I first used it for my pinto beans and then I tried it on Spaghetti. I was really amazed that I didn't lose 1 single noodle to the sink. Would not use it for rice as the slots are to wide. I used to use the lid to drain but would burn my fingers or lose food down the sink. This is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Looking for quality

customer_reviews.title: can’t clip it to pot
customer_reviews.text: Very dissapointed I wanted to clip it to a pot I use in the microwave but cannot open the clips enough. They barely open. The pot has a straight thin edge. I have no pots this will go on. Also I wouldn’t want to struggle with it if the pot was hot and so were it’s contents. I tried with a cold empty pot planning to add stuff and heat after it was on. IF you could get it to clip to a pot I think it would work very well but I couldn’t so of no use to me
customer_reviews.author: Northern light

customer_reviews.title: Not Good.
customer_reviews.text: Did not work. The item was flimsy. The food fell right onto the gizmo & into the kitchen sink. We threw it away.
customer_reviews.author: g2gmix

customer_reviews.title: It Doesn't Work
customer_reviews.text: I tried using this with a multitude of pots and it just does not work. You either burn your hands trying to keep the thing in place as you drain it, or the things you're trying to strain fall out into the sink. Waste of money. Just buy a normal strainer.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn Broderick

customer_reviews.title: Would really only work for small pots.
customer_reviews.text: Too small, it says it works for all pot/pan sizes but everything falls over the strainer. Would really only work for small pots. Example photo is a very small pot.
customer_reviews.author: DS

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced semi functional strainer
customer_reviews.text: This strainer works with small amounts of food but it does not drain well when there's lots of food in the pan/pot. It drains very slowly and leaves a lot of liquid behind. My hands and arms got tired of holding the pot waiting for the liquid to drain. When there's a lot of food, I put the pot's lid over the strainer to keep the food from falling out. I ended up going back to using my full size strainer/colander. I won't return it since I've used it and don't want to lose money sending it back. It is not a good replacement for a full size strainer/colander. I would not recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: JC Butler

customer_reviews.title: Does the job but not very easily
customer_reviews.text: I have a tendency of making large dishes, so I cook large amounts of food in my pans. I hate draining because it’s such a pain. I thought this product would help. It does the job but I have food overflowing the top of it as I tip to drain it. So I feel like I’m kind of doing two jobs at the same time now. If I make a small amount of food, not so bad. I’ll be looking for a different product.
customer_reviews.author: Kendra Deal

customer_reviews.title: Really wanted to love this thing but did not
customer_reviews.text: I was very disappointed. Would not fit on a single one of my cookware items. In frustration I just threw it away. The clips simply do not open wide enough for common pots and pans.
customer_reviews.author: SAGISANI

customer_reviews.title: Spills more than it saves.
customer_reviews.text: This item fits only one pan size well. All other sized pots or pans or pyrex bowls do not fit well. This means solid food spill off to the sides -- and lands somewhere on the counter top. Often, it will spill both contents as well as leak liquid off to the sides. The holding clips also are designed for one size. They are difficult to fix on most sized pans. Once fixed they do not hold in place well. A great idea. Just not well designed for the task.
customer_reviews.author: J. R. M.

customer_reviews.title: Works great but wish it covered more...
customer_reviews.text: It clips on securely to the side of my pots, but in order to tip it up high enough to really drain all of the liquid or grease out of the pan, the food can start to fall out from behind the wall/barrier where it's supposed to keep the food in the pan. If you push the food down so that it's mostly contained behind the barrier, that helps. I've found that in order to keep the food in the pan, you will end up with some liquid or grease still in the pan - you can't tip it up high enough to get it all out. If it was a little wider, it would be awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very convenient strainer for small electric pots
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a little hot pot to cook pasta at work, and I was able to find this strainer and it fits perfectly and keeps the hot water away from me and the sensitive electronics of the pot when draining.
customer_reviews.author: Bwatching

customer_reviews.title: Concept is promising but fails in long run.
customer_reviews.text: Hasn't proven itself as our go to strainer. We wish it didn't leak on the underside, but the clips don't seem to be holding as tight as they should. Company resent out a second after the first one had a completely broken clip but the performance is still coming up short. We live in a tiny space so this would have been ideal for us if it worked as advertised but since it hasn't we are now storing twice as many strainers that only an old bulky one is working.
customer_reviews.author: Troy Wyld

customer_reviews.title: A LIFESAVER!!!
customer_reviews.text: A LIFESAVER!!! i make a lot of pasta dishes so i require a strainer quite a bit. with this lonely invention, i don’t have to bring out an entire colander and i don’t have to worry about transferring the pasta from the colander back into the pot. i was never good at that and always spilled some! now i just clip this on tl the side of the pot and boom!
customer_reviews.author: jackie

customer_reviews.title: Better Than Expected
customer_reviews.text: I was a little bit skeptical that this strainer would work well on pots ranging from 6 inches diameter to 12 inches diameter. So far, it has exceeded my expectations and I am completely satisfied. Since it is dishwasher safe, cleanup is NO problem. This strainer has excellent design work supporting it.
customer_reviews.author: Tired Engineer

customer_reviews.title: This looked like a good idea
customer_reviews.text: This looked like a good idea, and it may just be me, but I have a hard time attaching it to the lip of the pan so that stuff doesn't fall out or it doesn't fall off. I've used it a few times but finally went back to a normal collinder for draining and donated this to Goodwill
customer_reviews.author: Karen S

customer_reviews.title: Makes thing easier
customer_reviews.text: I always had a problem with pouring out grease and this thing really helps. It's easy enough to put on the edge of a pan, although sometimes the thicker cast iron pans take a bit of work to get on there properly. The on;y other downside is if you are draining a lot of meat in a larger pan it's not that tall so you can't go fully vertical. Other than that it's easy enough to slip onto a pan and get grease poured out without accidentally dumping meat or not getting all the grease out. I got this product for both my mom and grandmother as well and they love it.
customer_reviews.author: Summer Koenig

customer_reviews.title: Such a space saver
customer_reviews.text: I had a bigger colander originally but it was so bulky and took up so much space in my life. I needed something sleek and small. This thing was perfect! I saw ads for it before and never paid it any mind but after making tons of pasta during COVID, I realized my big colander had to go. It fits on my pot well and strains the water out without a mess. Super simple to use and easy clean up.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa M.

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I really like this product. Mostly if you’re cooking for 2-4 people. I feel like if you have too much meat/pasta it may spill over the lip of the strainer. Lost a few noodles to the sink with it. But I do still really like the convenience of it & how easy it is to store. It’s way sturdier than I thought it would be & does fit all of our pots. I do choose to use this over our other strainers now so it must be good.
customer_reviews.author: Bri N

customer_reviews.title: This thing is AMAZING!
customer_reviews.text: So easy to use! Just clip on the side of any pot, pan, bowl, whatever, and it does all the work for you! Stays put and keeps the solids inside the container while straining out the liquid. Best kitchen gadget I ever purchased for myself.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie Courtney

customer_reviews.title: Good product, could be even better.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this product and use it frequently. My only 2 suggestions to make it better would be that one, it's on the small side not really helpful if you have family-sized food to strain. My other suggestion would be the clips. They are hard to get onto a pot or skillet, so I end up having to attach the strainer before I cook, which makes stirring harder as you have to stir under the strainer.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Great idea, just needs to be a bit bigger!
customer_reviews.text: This is great for smaller amounts of things.I have a bigger family, and tend to cook bigger batches, and it doesn't quite hold things enough for me. For example, it clips onto 5.5qt pot that I most frequently use. However, 1 lb of pasta is the limit, and even then you have to be careful to catch those pieces that try to jump over the edge. Do any more than that and I have to drain it into a colander to catch the rest - which means it's not useful. The idea is great, but it needs to be taller / bigger!
customer_reviews.author: Amital

customer_reviews.title: What did I do before this?`
customer_reviews.text: How did I go so long without having one of these strainers? Seriously. It is wonderful. You just clip it onto the pot and then strain away. I always hated having those large strainers/colanders and having to find room in the sink to put it down before so that I could just train my pasta etc. Now, I just clip this on and that's it! (Although, do be careful what you pour the boiling water onto - it can break glass if poured directly onto a jar.) Get this. You will love it!
customer_reviews.author: C. Klope

customer_reviews.title: It was a gift and she loves it
customer_reviews.text: My aunt loves to cook and every Christmas, I read a lot of reviews, research and look for something inventive for a gift for her kitchen. I originally read about this strainer in an article and then came here to read all the reviews before I purchased this strainer for her present. She calls me and sends me pictures of how much she loves it! It is a great product and I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Momx3

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I saw this in a article about useful tools in the kitchen. I was skeptical to purchase this. I have to say I have used it quite a few times, and I am very happy with the product. It clips on to your pot, and lets you get all the water out. It fits on different size pots as well. The first couple of times using it I was nervous it was going to unclip and everything would fall out. It holds tight and never came off. Its easy to clean off and really enjoy using it.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Never going back to a traditional strainer
customer_reviews.text: This universal strainer is a game changer for me. I bought this product for the first time about five years ago, and it has held up perfectly. Cleans easy, grips well, and really does fit just about any pot or pan you want to latch it to. I'm glad to see Kitchen Gizmo still making this product. Just bought this one for a family member who wanted one when she saw me use it.
customer_reviews.author: Sophie Erstad

customer_reviews.title: It Works and so Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this because I hate colanders, but of course I need to drain noodles and other things. I don’t like to drain large pots into colanders because they are unstable. This solves the problem! Very thick and sturdy silicone and the clamps work on my 12 inch pot. I hooked it on to several sizes of pots and found that it does work with every size. The clamps are tight so takes a second to connect them, but this ensures they won’t slip off. Nicely designed. Easy to use. Works as expected. Arrived on time. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: SlinkyPuffs

customer_reviews.title: A better strainer!
customer_reviews.text: I was so annoyed when my ya and talked incessantly about getting this thing instead of just using the big collapsible strainer we already have. Like no we don’t need more “stuff”! But alas, we ordered it, and it turns out we really did “need” this...and so do you! :)) It’s so convenient and much easier to use than a big clunky strainer in the sink. More sanitary too! Just buy it!
customer_reviews.author: etmama

customer_reviews.title: This strainer works great!
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had known about this product years ago. It's easy to attach to our pots and does an excellent job of draining pasta water. After we're done we just put it in the dishwasher and then it's ready for the next use. Before I always fumbled with one hand in a potholder trying to hold onto the pasta pot and hold onto the colander with my other hand. Now I can use both hands to safely drain the pasta.
customer_reviews.author: Myrtle Warbler

customer_reviews.title: No, it WON'T fit ALL bowls and pots!
customer_reviews.text: Sorry, I don't cook potatoes in a small sauce pan. No way will this fit all pots and bowls as it says in the description.
customer_reviews.author: P Hensley

customer_reviews.title: I could burn myself
customer_reviews.text: This strainer looked interesting at first and thought it would be a good replacement for our old bulky strainers. We bought it and fit it onto our pots and quickly realized it was not the best design. I couldn't justify using it on a boiling hot pot of water. Had some difficulty clipping it on, not a good design over a hot pot of water. Instead I bought a strainer that flattens out that can go over the sink. This design is just to risky to use in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Such a time saver
customer_reviews.text: I just love this! We eat a lot of pasta and this is such a time saver. I wish it was a bit “deeper” if I make a lot of pasta at one time I have to be careful not to tip it too far or I lose some noodles over the top. Leaving some water in the pot. Otherwise it stays on the pot erfectky
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not what I was hoping for
customer_reviews.text: I really like this idea and I wish it worked better. If your pot has a lip to the top, like most do, it’s difficult to clamp on. So much so that you could easily burn yourself or knock the boiling pot over trying to clamp on lid.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: So easy to clean, space saving
customer_reviews.text: I HATE cleaning strainers and I hate how much space they take up so I couldn't pass up trying this product. It's been a true lifesaver! Who knew that this silicone material would be THAT much easier to clean?! And it takes up way less space. When I first took it out of the package and looked at it, I was skeptical, but after about 10 uses, I am in love!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica E.

customer_reviews.title: Just the coolest kitchen gadget
customer_reviews.text: Hands down one of the better kitchen gadgets. This beats using a lid or a large colander to drain pasta, or grease or fat off cooked meats. It has fit all my pots and pans, and has been really easy to clean. The material it is made out of seems to almost repel grease and other things that might stick on cookware. super handy and they will be gifts for my family members.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Worth the purchase.
customer_reviews.text: Fun little strainer that fits into multiple pots and pans and makes straining a lot less of a clean up since you're using less "ish" items. The snaps are a little frustrating with pans that have a lip but you get use to that after a few uses and its relatively easy to clean in comparison to our traditional strainers. And the lime green is VERY lime green. Easy to find.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony L

customer_reviews.title: Went into garbage after first use
customer_reviews.text: The product simply did not work. It was difficult to clip onto the pan, and then the strainer portion bowed inward so that when I poured out the water the contents also spilled out. This took a long time to arrive because it is shipped from overseas, and it was a long wait to be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J Janavel

customer_reviews.title: Wish it was a little "taller"
customer_reviews.text: It's OK; you need to be a little careful when making a full box of pasta as it's easy to lose some noodles when you pour out the water. Getting it on and off the pot is pretty easy, and it forms pretty well to whatever round pot you're putting it on (haven't tried a pot with a lip, so I don't know if it'll work with that). Update: we've gotten new sets of pots that do have a lip, and this won't work with them. Reduced it to 3 stars.
customer_reviews.author: GK

customer_reviews.title: Hard to use on boxed Mac & cheese sized pan
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to make it easier to prepare boxed Mac & cheese. This strainer is well made, but is extremely difficult to use with my 2 quart sauce pan. It might work better on a larger pan with no lips on the pan side, but for me, it is more difficult than using a strainer. Sorry....really wanted it to work. Returns were easy.
customer_reviews.author: Larry L. Emsweller

customer_reviews.title: It's okay, but the picture doesn't match what I received.
customer_reviews.text: In the picture above with the product, it shows the section with all the little slits as bowing outward so that it can hold back any food from falling out when you're draining stuff. The one I got has that section bowing downward towards the bottom of the pan. I cooked 2 pounds of ground beef and tried to drain it but a lot of the meat just fell right over the top and into the trash can where I was draining it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Garbage... Don’t buy... :-(
customer_reviews.text: I bought this strainer for my 65-year-old mom who said that she was so excited when she first received it. Unfortunately while the silicone strainer itself seems durable the clips that go onto the pot are trash... They came off the pot and my mother nearly got Badly burned... She said that it was total trash... How sad...v
customer_reviews.author: Mama Duck

customer_reviews.title: Really useful.
customer_reviews.text: This falls into the category of "Now why didn't somebody do this years ago." The only thing in the kitchen it won't go on is the slow cooker liner. With any other pot or pan It fits on easily and quickly. It does a perfect job on draining boiled potatoes, pasta, or any vegetables. As it is made of silicone with stainless steel springs in the clamps it is difficult to see how it would wear out. Easy and simple to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Phil M.

customer_reviews.title: Great alternative to traditional strainer
customer_reviews.text: I hate trying to strain pasta from a bowl into a strainer in the sink particularly if the hot water doesn’t drain immediately into the sink drain. This alleviates that issue. It’s easy to use. The strainer attaches to the pot and covers the top of the pot halfway. So long as you are not cooking a huge pot of pasta, it strains just fine. If you are cooking a lot of pasta some of the pasta could fall out.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as expected
customer_reviews.text: It’s a little hard to install on a pan or pot. Can’t really drain the whole liquid without having whatever in the pan/pot falling out. At the end, gets frustrating and realize using a colander is much easier snd faster
customer_reviews.author: N.

customer_reviews.title: Great little strainer!
customer_reviews.text: I Received my order quickly. This is a great product. I was a little disappointed when using it on a pound of larger noodles. The part with the strainer doesn't come up high enough to prevent the pasta from coming over the top. For my needs.. it's perfect, I live alone and usally don't cook large amounts of pasta at a time. If I do have to cook a large amount of pasta...I pill out my large stainless steel strainer.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie

customer_reviews.title: It lives up to its internet reputation
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great. I had read all the reviews singing its praises but it really is as amazing as they said. It is really thick soft silicone with easier to clean longer holes. It clamps on relatively easily and stays on really well. The best part is just how much easier it is to clean than a normal colander.
customer_reviews.author: Nope

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Product! Highly Recommend!
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful product! Very useful. I use this to drain fat from ground hamburger meat in the skillet. It's great - holds in the meat while easily draining away the fat. No more meat dumping in the sink. Works exactly the way I had hoped. The kind of gadget that makes life a thousand times easier!! Also super easy to attach, un-attach, and cleans up well in the dishwasher.
customer_reviews.author: M.P.

customer_reviews.title: Works really great. Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used mine about 5 times and I really love it. I throw it in the dishwasher when I’m done. I have some 1 qt pots I wasn’t sure if it would fit or if it did fit would it be hard to put onto the pot. I’m happy to say. Not hard. Very easy. So much nicer than putting the items into a strainer and then on my plate. I’m very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: S. Carroll

customer_reviews.title: Smell. Plastic/Chemical...?
customer_reviews.text: Looks like it will do the job...however, it has a chemical smell to it that I cannot stand. I washed it few times hoping that this nasty odor/plastic smell goes away. If it does, I will come back and update the rating.
customer_reviews.author: klex

customer_reviews.title: So easy!
customer_reviews.text: I love this! It's so much easier to clean than my regular strainer and I love that it attaches onto the pot I was already using so I don't have to scrape any stuck noodles. I also tried this on a really large frying pan, to drain grease off of my hamburger meat. The first attempt, I lost a few pieces over the top, but it was easily remedied by scooting all the meat to the strainer side and THEN draining. That's only a concern on the really large pans though. Every other pot or pan I've used with has been 100% saved noodles and meat with no hassle!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Cleveland

customer_reviews.title: Really does fit all sizes
customer_reviews.text: I have weak wrists and it is hard for me to hold a strainer while pouring so I was so excited to find this! I tried it on a smaller pan and it had to bend some so I was fully expected it to leak--but it didn't. Worked great!! I would like to see this in other colors, although it IS easy to find.
customer_reviews.author: TripleR

customer_reviews.title: Life changing
customer_reviews.text: Hands down the best invention since sliced bread. If you do not have one of these, get one, maybe two. Then buy them for all of your loved ones for holidays or birthday gift. So much easier to use than a huge strainer and it’s so easy to clean. It bends to fit literally any pot. 11/10 recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Cody and Mariah

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: I like the strainer. I had a bit of difficulty fitting it onto a pot with a rather large lip. I also wasn't sure if it would hold the 1 lb. plus of ravioli once I started straining it, but it actually worked just fine as advertised. I would buy it again based on the few times I've used it. It's more convenient to use than a colander, takes up less space, and is easier to clean.
customer_reviews.author: cmetcalf7

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Product for the Smaller Straining Jobs
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I’ve wanted FOR YEARS! I hate dirty-ing a strainer just for something that only needs a bit of water or grease drained. If you need to strain noodles, use a full strainer because it needs time to fully drain and cool, but if you are making Mac-n-Cheese or cooking hamburger, you only need to drain off the excess - that’s the perfect purpose of this item. It snaps onto any pot or pan and lets you strain rather than drain. It works great and I LOVE THIS PRODUCT!
customer_reviews.author: Shannon WTop Contributor: Makeup

customer_reviews.title: New favorite kitchen gadget I actually use!
customer_reviews.text: We absolutely love this strainer! It's so easy to use and scrunches to fit a smaller pot. It holds back all the noodles no problem and even tiny noodles don't fit through the slats. It is a bit tricky to clean if you don't do it right away but that's to be expected. Rinse it immediately and it is no problem. My new favorite kitchen gadget I actually use!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works well on wide mouths like spaghetti pots
customer_reviews.text: Works well on wide mouths like spaghetti pots. Does have a wee bit of a problem with small pans and the items being drained. It tends to bow in and if you are draining tortellie or ravioli you have to get something to lift the "screen" up so that it catches the pasta. Saves me getting out the colander.
customer_reviews.author: D. Givens

customer_reviews.title: It is a good item
customer_reviews.text: I like the strainer, my only problem is maybe it is too good. By that I mean, I have hand problems and it took a little more effort of both hands to use the snaps the first time. But other than that I am very pleased and it worked well. I've only used it one time, but would say it is doing good.
customer_reviews.author: Judy Kluegel

customer_reviews.title: It works perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Now that I've used it a couple times, I can already see it's going to be awesome. That I can clip it to my pan so that I have both hands free to hold the pan is so very helpful. It's a wonderful product, and it seems sturdy. Rinsing it directly after use also makes for easier cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

customer_reviews.title: This thing is great!
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing! I received one as a wedding present and was kind of skeptical that it would work well. I was wrong. It works great. I can use it on my large pots and my small pots. It is easy to clip on and strain quickly. I have used it straining boiled potatoes and noodles. It cleans up easily and it not overly bulky.
customer_reviews.author: M.H.

customer_reviews.title: Nice Strainer
customer_reviews.text: I make large pots of chai tea and made an absolute mess trying to stain the spice bits out. This has helped so much. i still manage to leak some here and there and still have to run it though a wire mesh strainer (these holes are a bit too large). All in all, it's a good product and I do recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A Strainer that works exactly as it should!
customer_reviews.text: This works great for us! It works exactly as it should for straining pasta. We use it with our cast iron and other skillets to drain fat/liquid when necessary. We love that it doesn't scratch non stick pots and pans. It is great that it is easy to clean and is also dishwasher safe. This is a really good product.
customer_reviews.author: Krasmer

customer_reviews.title: Saw it on the Today Show
customer_reviews.text: I have very bad thumbs and I am always loosing products I am trying to strain with a lid because my thumbs won't hold that pressure for long. Saw it on the Today's show and ordered it right away. So easy to use and saved loosing food down the drain and hurting my hands. Easy to clean. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Marcia Blazer

customer_reviews.title: It works well
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my boyfriend to use when we cook meat or pasta, so that we wouldn't have to haul out a colander every time, which are a pain to clean and take up so much room. This works well on our regular pots and pans, but the clips are too small to fit it onto our wok, which is a little annoying as it's easily our most used cooking pot. Otherwise, its a breeze to just throw it in the dishwasher and takes very little adjusting to fit from a small saucepan to a full size skillet.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Bougher

customer_reviews.title: So useful!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this on a whim to try it out, and now I don't think I could live without it! It drains grease or water or whatever out of you pan without getting liquid down the side, and it saves so much room in the dishwasher from my bulky metal strainer. I've used it so far on multiple pan sizes with no issues with it fitting, and the silicone doesn't get hot or scratch my pans. Overall great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Emily Boyles

customer_reviews.title: Great for anything from ramen to draining fat from ground ...
customer_reviews.text: Great for anything from ramen to draining fat from ground beef. In fact it is amazing for draining fat from ground beef. I used to put a paper towel in a colander and drain it that way, but it's still a mess. This thing lets you drain it from the pan you cooked it in so less mess and quicker. Only complaint I have is that its kinda small. If you have more than a pound of beef or so, you will have to be careful that it doesn't fall over the edge.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Person

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't fit large fry pan
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to drain after cooking items in a frying pan (such a taco meat). It was a pain to clip and did not flushly fit the pain, making it tough for draining.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Gill

customer_reviews.title: Probably will never use it.
customer_reviews.text: Clipping it on to a hot pan is not exactly easy. This is a gadget like the avocado slicer . it will never get used.
customer_reviews.author: James W. Land

customer_reviews.title: Good product, wish it was a little taller.
customer_reviews.text: Good product. Works well and attaches firmly. I wish it was a little taller for the big batches of noodles and broccoli. It's silicone, so I'm not sure how long it will hold up, but for now we're very happy with it. So much easier than pulling out the big strainer and it fits in the dishwasher a lot easier. Fits more of our pots.
customer_reviews.author: gary

customer_reviews.title: Soft and strong
customer_reviews.text: I used this strainer for the first time yesterday. Where have you been all of my life. It clipped onto the pot with no slippage. The food flowed into the strainer perfectly and all of the fat was drained out. This is a very helpful tool. I am very glad I discovered your product. No negatives.
customer_reviews.author: MaryAnn

customer_reviews.title: I use this almost every day. Should have bought two!!
customer_reviews.text: We make a lot of boiled vegetables and pasta in my house and this device works like a charm. There isn’t much to it so it’s easy to clean and it’s size makes it easy to store. Whether you have a large family or live alone, this gadget is a time and space making asset for your kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Holzhauer

customer_reviews.title: Innovative Solution for Straining Liquids
customer_reviews.text: Very nice product. Fits any size pot. The side clamps keeps it on tight and work great for metal pots however I have some Visions glass pots that have thick sides and the the clamps really have to stretch to fit. I hope the glass pots do not weaken the clamps for other pots. Overall I give this product my highest rating for innovation and practicality.
customer_reviews.author: Taltos

customer_reviews.title: I love the idea of this strainer
customer_reviews.text: I love the idea of this strainer, but the chemical smell really turned me off. I ran it through the dishwasher and I can still smell the chemicals. I won't use this because I am afraid my food may pick up the scent. It was obvious that it had been sent back previously, because the box it came in was ripped.
customer_reviews.author: Eva

customer_reviews.title: Very Helpful
customer_reviews.text: Works really well! We have heavy pots that are hard to empty into a traditional colander. The Snap ‘n’ Strainer solves that problem without adding much weight to the pot. I’ve used it on my smaller pots and a larger one and it worked great both times.
customer_reviews.author: g2g

customer_reviews.title: Does not work with pots  that have heavy lip.
customer_reviews.text: Neat idea, works OK but not as sturdy as I thought it would be. Also pots that have a heavy lip make it difficult to position. Must be careful when draining due to hot steam.
customer_reviews.author: Marshall Hulton

customer_reviews.title: Pasta game changer
customer_reviews.text: Um, this thing is seriously awesome. I don't know that I have ever written a review on anything other than a book or a movie, but I love this enough to make a change. I was interested in buying this because I saw that it was marked down one day during an Amazon deal. I really don't cook much except pasta, so I'm always looking for ways to up my pasta game. This is it! It is much smaller than a typical strainer, and it does just as great of a job if not better. I know that this is minor in the entirety of life, but I wish I would have bought this years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Kirsten Trambley

customer_reviews.title: Really works
customer_reviews.text: A brilliant kitchen item that really works bought one for my self, and one for each of my young adult children. We love that it takes so little space no need for big clunky strainers anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Meeeeh
customer_reviews.text: It's ok. Can't drain the fluid completely because the part that holds the food back isn't wide enough. Food just spills over the top of the strainer if tilted too much.
customer_reviews.author: Kay F.

customer_reviews.title: Not so good strainer
customer_reviews.text: The first time I used it, I made sure I had it securely on the pot. When I tried to drain the pasta it ended up in the sink! Afraid to use it now.
customer_reviews.author: Marsha Siegel

customer_reviews.title: Enjoyed it so much, I bought a second one.
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome little gadget. I have a large strainer that I used to use, but it is bulky and took up a lot of room. I also camp a lot and we make mac and cheese, but we don't have a ton of storage in the camper so carrying around bulky kitchen items doesn't work. I figured this would suck, but I bought it anyway to give it a try. Ended up buying a 2nd one because the first one was so awesome. I have a lot of pots and pans and haven't found one it will not work on yet. Storage is easy, and it's easy to clean. Would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: looks easier to use than it is
customer_reviews.text: What you forget is you have to attach it to the pot when it's scalding hot, which makes it way more difficult to manage... after using it a few times it became one more item in my kitchen that never gets used in favor of a good old fashioned strainer that sits in the sink
customer_reviews.author: Dr.J.A.P.

customer_reviews.title: Genius!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great. It’s amazing no one’s made anything like this before now. I’ve only had it for a couple days, but I’ve already used it a handful of times and it’s extremely convenient. It’s also very compact and easy to clean and store. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie G.

customer_reviews.title: Great strainer!! Works so easily!
customer_reviews.text: Just ordered this and works with many of my pots and pans. Cleans well in the dishwasher. Hard to drain all fat when using more than a pound of ground beef in a 12" saucepan, meat almost fell out of pan (you can only tip the pan soo much ya know). Otherwise great product and glad I have one. Better than straining in my old one.
customer_reviews.author: StanginTXMom

customer_reviews.title: This really works!!
customer_reviews.text: This has made my life much easier when I make pasta and boil potatoes! I can now dump the water and pasta out and into a strainer bowl all by myself! MUCH easier than trying to hold a lid while you're dumping a big, heavy pot! Love this thing. And you can just put it in the dishwasher!
customer_reviews.author: Okie Dokie KO

customer_reviews.title: This is the best kitchen "gadget" I have in my kitchen
customer_reviews.text: BUY IT! You won't regret the decision. This is the best kitchen "gadget" I have in my kitchen! It's easy to use, safe on my pots/pans and cuts way down on the amount of dishes to clean after preparing a meal. I usually use it to drain pasta but have also used it to drain grease from cooked meat... excellent tool for the job! Takes up very little space (in comparison to a colander) in both the dishwasher and my cabinets.
customer_reviews.author: T. Evans

customer_reviews.title: Awesome kitchen gadget!
customer_reviews.text: Love this strainer! It attaches to almost any pot or pan and stays in place while in use. It's so much easier to use than getting out a full size colander. I usually hand wash mine but have also put it in the top rack of the dishwasher and it holds up very well!
customer_reviews.author: Athena Green

customer_reviews.title: Strain pots the Easy Way!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I got tired of having to try and hold a colander and empty a two handled pot at the same time. I only have a smaller one bay sink and sometimes, especially in the middle of cooking, there are dirty dishes in it so I have nowhere to put a colander or strainer. This clips on with very tight clips so you won't have to worry about it coming off. The slots or narrow so you don't have to worry about the pasta slipping through. It can be thrown in the dishwasher or quickly washed by hand. It's silicone and stands up to the heat well. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: cheryl costella

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy fit on the pot
customer_reviews.text: With a regular strainer you have to clean your sink first and that’s the step I always forget. Don’t need that with this! And it fits in the dishwasher great. Only downside is I find it a little hard to clip on but that’s just me. It’s good that it’s a sturdy fit on the pot
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So worth it!
customer_reviews.text: This is the coolest kitchen gadget I've bought in a long time. No filling the dishwasher with huge colanders, you snap this on your cooking pot and drain. Then a quick wash in the sink and you're done. Holds securely and I've only lost a few noodles over the top edge when the pan was too small for what I was making. I made angel hair pasta fully expecting it to go all through the holes like a regular colander, and they didn't even poke through let alone come out!
customer_reviews.author: Holly B Nash

customer_reviews.title: easy and lightweight way t strain hot foods
customer_reviews.text: This is such an easy way to strain anything in any pot. I found the item on another web site and purchased it through amazon. I was not disappointed. It fits any pot and is lightweight. I was previously using items where I had to use both hands to drain items and it was heavy and difficult to do without spilling the food into the sink. his is so mach easier. When I am done with it I put it in the dishwasher for easy cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: Bibi

customer_reviews.title: Would buy this again!!!
customer_reviews.text: Before I purchased this, I read a majority of the 5-star and 1-star reviews. I felt the probable good outweighed the potential bad so I bought it. And it works totally as advertised! It’s sturdy, fits well on all my pots and pans (both straight sides and lipped) and i haven’t lost a single piece of food yet! On smaller diameter items, you may need to make a minor adjustment, but then it holds in place great!!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Lane

customer_reviews.title: Amazing strainer
customer_reviews.text: At first I was skeptical about this working. I really wanted something that wouldn’t require me having to clean a large strainer just to drain one portion of pasta. This has been a huge game changer in my kitchen. I highly recommend this anyone looking for a strainer
customer_reviews.author: ST

product_meta.title: Kitchen Gizmo Snap N Strain Strainer, Clip On Silicone Colander, Fits all Pots and Bowls - Lime Green
feature_bullets: ORIGINAL MANUFACTURERS: This is the original Snap n' Strain designed and manufactured by Kitchen Gizmo!
UNIVERSAL DESIGN: The specially designed clips will fit nearly all round pots, pans, and big and small bowls (including lipped bowls).
SPACE SAVING: Small, compact strainer that is easy to use and store in a quarter the size of the traditional colander. Great when working with limited counter space.
PACKAGE INCLUDES: One Snap N’ Strain Strainer (Green)
KITCHEN GIZMO GUARANTEE: All our products come with a 1-year warranty. We will replace all defective products if purchased brand new from Amazon - free of charge.
